summary: “Just tell her exactly what I told you! I promise it’ll work–go on!” With Bran Stark + Jon Snow
title: “Just tell her exactly what I told you! I promise it’ll work–go on!” With Bran Stark + Jon Snow
body:
You passed through the working field with a smile as you witness those work in their daily lives. Unknown to you Jon and Bran are having a conversation involving you. “Just tell her exactly what I told you! I promise it’ll work-go on!”

Arya from Jon’s side rolled her eyes at her half brother’s advise knowing Bran will get too shy and run away.

Bran walked to the young girl with his head down, “H-hey Y/N”, he stuttered as Arya chuckles only to be stopped by Jon giving her a look. “I-I want to s-say that I-I would…like to co-”, Y/N stood there unsure what the boy in front is trying to tell her until Arya comes in. “He wants to court you!” “Arya!” Jon and Bran scolded her then Bran ran after Arya leaving the girl standing there.

Hey I'm Shadow.
Female. 26. Gamer.
This is a ship friendly blog. You like a certain ship? I dont care whether I like it or not because I mind my own damn business and leave you alone.
I'm open minded to multiple ships in one fandom because why the fuck not? That doesn't mean I don't have an OTP I'm just chill.
Xemnas/Sora shipper since KH2 came out.
I write.
I make videos sometimes.
I post my friend's art for her since she doesn't have a tumblr.
I reblog whatever is my fancy. I also get random mood changes and spam random things straight. Oops. 
I will most likely post something REALLY clever every so often.

summary: Queen of Westeros ( Reader x Bran Stark)
title: Queen of Westeros ( Reader x Bran Stark)
body:
Requested by: Anon, Forever tag: @spxce-frxckles, @alex–awesome–22, @httpschanwoo, @miss-fangirl72, @fandomnerdsarecool, @thedeadlymaria

Silence… it was silence when all the lords and ladies of Westeros were seated down in a circle under an open tent. Grey worm was standing in front of them in the sun with Tyrion by his side, with chains around his wrists. It was an intense moment as you inhaled deep, softly pushing your fingers deeper into Bran’s shoulder. Tyrion looked brief at Grey worm before he started to speak. – “Jon’s faith is to be decided by our king… or queen.” – Tyrion then looked humble at each and everyone of them as a lord sitting next to Lord Arryn spoke. – “We don’t have a king or queen?” – Tyrion softly nodded with his head as he smiled faintly. – “You are all the most powerful people in Westeros… choose one”

Tyrion looked up to Grey worm who exhaled deep, keeping his face in a firm expression. – “Make your choice then!” – You could hear at the tone of Grey worm’s voice that he rather had Jon be executed for his actions right now. Another moment of silence broke free as everyone looked at each other without moving a bit. The tension was nerve-racking as you grabbed Bran’s shoulder even tighter. Your muscles relaxed a bit as you felt Bran’s hand touch yours that laid on his shoulder. Sansa made some eye contact with Yara beside her as Brienne of Tarth looked brief at you. Suddenly the Stark’s uncle’s chair cracked as he got up and stepped closer into the middle.

You looked with curious eyes at his movements as Bran had let go of your hand. – “My lords and ladies…” – he started as he cleared his throat soft. – “I suppose this is the most important moment of our lives…” – Everyone was staring at him as Tyrion shook softly his head. – “What we decided today will forever live on in history! I stand before you as one of the senior lords of the country” – You pressed your lips softly together as the tension was getting to much. – “A veteran of two wars and I’d like to think my experiences lead to some small…-“- He continued to speak as suddenly a voice broke through his speech. – “Uncle!” – Sansa had spoken as everyone looked directly at her. – “Please sit!” – He blinked a bit confused as Sansa signalled to his seat with her head.

Her uncle looked nervously around as everyone started to hide their laughs. You also tried to hide your laughing as you were impressed by Sansa’s sudden comment. Her uncle then looked behind him as Sam pretended to look at anywhere but him as he knew how awkward that was. He then looked at Sansa with an expression, making it clear to her that he didn’t appreciated her comment. He then stepped back as he wanted to seat himself down, but his sword bumped against the side. You chuckled quietly as Bran looked up at you. You immediately stopped laughing as you knew it was wrong from you to laugh at his uncle.

“We have to choose someone?” – the same elderly man said that was sitting next to Lord Arryn. Sam Tarly cleared his throat as everyone looked at him in silence. – “Why just us?” – you frowned deep as Sam got up from his seat, nervously. – “We represent all the great houses but whoever we choose won’t just rule over lords and ladies…” – You listened closely as Sam was indeed right. – “Maybe the decision about what’s best for everyone should be left to … oh… well everyone?” – Immediately started several ladies and lords to chuckle quietly as they didn’t want to hear another word of this strange request from Sam.

As everyone was looking at each other some lords started to laugh loud at his silly request. – “Maybe we should give the dogs a vote as well!” – Bran’s uncle laughed out as everyone was laughing at Sam. Sam smiled faintly as he tried to hide his sadness and seated himself quickly down. – “Should I ask my horse?” – the old lord laughed out as you had enough of their laughter. – “That’s enough!” – you called out in a calm but powerful tone as they suddenly stopped laughing. – “I suppose you want the crown?” – Bran’s uncle asked Tyrion as Tyrion was looking down in a humble way. – “Me? The imp?” – he shook his head as you felt like there was no progress. – “Half of the people hate me for serving Daenerys, the other half hates me for betraying her…” – Tyrion then briefly looked at Grey Worm who still stood in his soldier position.

“Who then?” – Sir Davos spoke as Tyrion took a deep breath. – “I’ve had nothing else to do but think these past few weeks…” – Tyrion started again, - “about our bloody history!” – He looked brief at his right as he continued, - “About the mistakes we’ve made…” – He looked again brief at Grey worm who rejected his apologetic expression as Tyrion suddenly looked in front of him at you. – “What unites people?” – he spoke again as he started to walk around. – “Armies? Gold? Flags?” – he shook his head as he looked up to his left. – “Stories…”

Tyrion kept walking around as he suddenly paused and slowly turned around. – “And who has a better story than Y/n the valiant!” – All the lord and ladies’ eyes went straight to you as you lifted your hands up from Bran’s shoulder out of shock. Sansa and Arya looked at you with shock as Tyrion kept looking directly at you. – “Lost both of her parents in the war… Survived for many years alone… helped Brandon Stark on his journey beyond the wall…” – Everyone kept looking at you as Tyrion kept telling everyone your life’s story. – “Showed more bravery then anyone I know…” – Tyrion nodded soft at you as you still couldn’t believe that Tyrion wanted you to be Queen of the seven kingdoms.

“Was prepared to sacrifice her own life for the people of Kingslanding that weren’t even her own…” – You were so overwhelmed that you took a step closer to Tyrion, standing next to Bran. – “In the many times I’ve encountered Y/n she kept surprising me with her determination and bravery…” – Tyrion now spoke to the other lords and Ladies as Sansa bit her lip, looking not very pleased with the outcome. – “If there was someone I would believe in, it would be Y/n the valiant!” – You gasped soft as Bran had taken your hand and placed a kiss on it.

“Y/n can’t rule the seven kingdoms?” – Sansa said as you looked at her. – “She’s to young and Bran can’t bare her children!” – You gave her a foul look as Bran looked the same at her. – “Good!” – Tyrion said, - “Children of a Queen can be cruel and stupid… as you know all too well…”  - Sansa stopped talking as Tyrion had shown her, her place. – “I believe in her!” – Bran spoke as he looked up to you and smiled. – “I believe in her too! She will be a great queen that will value the voice of her people!” – Arya said as she nodded at you. You nodded back at her as Bran kissed your hand again.

“Y/n?” – Tyrion asked you as you took some deep breaths. Tyrion then looked at everyone else to see if anyone would protest. – “I believe we should vote then…” – Tyrion looked at his left as you held Bran’s hand firm. – “Aye!” – the first men said out loud as it only increased your nerves. – “Aye!” – the second and the third said. It went so on until you reached Sansa, she turned her body towards you as you prepared yourself to hear a no. – “Y/n if you let me… I want the north to be a free and an independent country… it has suffered more than enough for Westeros!” – You were surprised by her request, but you understood it fully.

“The North is from this day on an independent country!” – You called out as Sansa bowed her head out of respect to you. You did the same as you held one hand near your heart. – “Aye!” – she then said out loud, looking directly at Tyrion. Aria and Bran also said loud ‘Aye!’ as only a few more needed to say their vote. The rest of the lords and ladies all said ‘Aye!’ as Tyrion ended his vote with a nod. Tyrion then signalled to you as you took some more steps, making yourself more visible for everyone. – “All hail Y/n the valiant, First of her name…Queen of the Andals and the first men. Lady of the six kingdoms and protector of the realm!”

It felt glorious to hear the title come out of Tyrion’s mouth as he bowed his head in respect of you. Everyone started to clap loud for you as Tyrion smiled at you. You then moved to the back of Bran’s wheelchair as you started to push him away, all the others followed you as the council was over. Their Queen had been chosen and now they could all return home. You rolled with him in silence past Tyrion as you paused for a moment. – “Grey worm! I will make sure Tyrion will be faced with his actions at my council!” – Grey worm nodded with a forced expression as he removed the chains from around Tyrion’s wrists. – “Thank you, My queen!” – Tyrion said as you nodded at him and continued to walk with Bran to somewhere you could be alone. You leaded him to your tent as Kingslanding needed to be rebuild and it was to dangerous now to head into the city.

You parked Bran’s wheelchair near your bed as you stretched your back a bit, moving over to the mirror stand. Bran pulled himself a bit up by his arms as he wanted to sit down on your bed. You noticed him struggling as you came to his aid. – “You just should have asked!” – you said to him as you grabbed his legs and placed them on the bed. – “And let my Queen do all the work?” – he joked as you slightly shook your head. – “I still can’t believe everyone voted for me to be Queen of the six kingdoms?” – You had placed Bran in the best position for him to sit as you came sitting next to him with a deep exhale. – “You will be wonderful!” – he replied as he suddenly grabbed your waist and let himself fall.

You fell on top of Bran as you squealed loud. – “Brandon!” – you laughed out as he still had his arms around you. You slowly lifted your head to look at him better as he moved some hair of yours behind your ear. – “I don’t think I’m ready for such a big responsibility, Brandon…” – you said to him in a vulnerable tone as you looked away from him. – “Y/n I know for a fact that you will be the best queen, you are kind, strong, wise and most importantly mine…” – Bran forced you to smile as he ticked you soft. – “You truly believe in me?” – Bran nodded deep as you were leaning against his chest, fumbling a piece of his shirt.

Bran then pulled your body more down to reach for your lips as he pressed his lips gently onto yours. You slowly moved your hands to his neck as you kept kissing him repeatedly. Bran then rolled you over to your side so that you were laying next to him. You removed your lips from him and wrapped your arms around him, placing your head on his shoulder. Bran also wrapped his arms around you as he kept cuddling with you. – “I don’t even have a throne?” – you suddenly called out as you pulled your head up. Bran sighed soft as he placed your head down again and let his fingers play with yours. – “We’ll build you a new one… a better one!”

“One without the creepy swords?” – You asked him as Bran hummed deep. – “Without the swords.” – he then kissed the top of your head as you placed your head better on his chest. – “You know me being Queen makes you kind of my King?” – you waited for a moment because you knew Bran never had any intentions of becoming King of anything. – “I would be honoured to be by your side Y/n…” – he replied after a while as you lifted your head up again. – “So… you’re not abandoning me for being Queen?” – Bran gave you a quick shocked expression that you would think like that. – “Y/n I love you more than anything, I would never leave you not even when you are Queen now… I would love to be your King even though I can’t give you any children….” – You moved your hand to his cheek as you looked him into his eyes. – “I don’t want them… just you…” – you then pressed your lips again onto his as you felt him wrap his arms around you better.

————————————————————

Check out my Masterlist for more Game of thrones fics

Silence… it was silence when all the lords and ladies of Westeros were seated down in a circle under an open tent. Grey worm was standing in front of them in the sun with Tyrion by his side, with chains around his wrists. It was an intense moment as you inhaled deep, softly pushing your fingers deeper into Bran’s shoulder. Tyrion looked brief at Grey worm before he started to speak. – “Jon’s faith is to be decided by our king… or queen.” – Tyrion then looked humble at each and everyone of them as a lord sitting next to Lord Arryn spoke. – “We don’t have a king or queen?” – Tyrion softly nodded with his head as he smiled faintly. – “You are all the most powerful people in Westeros… choose one”

Tyrion looked up to Grey worm who exhaled deep, keeping his face in a firm expression. – “Make your choice then!” – You could hear at the tone of Grey worm’s voice that he rather had Jon be executed for his actions right now. Another moment of silence broke free as everyone looked at each other without moving a bit. The tension was nerve-racking as you grabbed Bran’s shoulder even tighter. Your muscles relaxed a bit as you felt Bran’s hand touch yours that laid on his shoulder. Sansa made some eye contact with Yara beside her as Brienne of Tarth looked brief at you. Suddenly the Stark’s uncle’s chair cracked as he got up and stepped closer into the middle.

[[MORE]]

You looked with curious eyes at his movements as Bran had let go of your hand. – “My lords and ladies…” – he started as he cleared his throat soft. – “I suppose this is the most important moment of our lives…” – Everyone was staring at him as Tyrion shook softly his head. – “What we decided today will forever live on in history! I stand before you as one of the senior lords of the country” – You pressed your lips softly together as the tension was getting to much. – “A veteran of two wars and I’d like to think my experiences lead to some small…-“- He continued to speak as suddenly a voice broke through his speech. – “Uncle!” – Sansa had spoken as everyone looked directly at her. – “Please sit!” – He blinked a bit confused as Sansa signalled to his seat with her head.

Her uncle looked nervously around as everyone started to hide their laughs. You also tried to hide your laughing as you were impressed by Sansa’s sudden comment. Her uncle then looked behind him as Sam pretended to look at anywhere but him as he knew how awkward that was. He then looked at Sansa with an expression, making it clear to her that he didn’t appreciated her comment. He then stepped back as he wanted to seat himself down, but his sword bumped against the side. You chuckled quietly as Bran looked up at you. You immediately stopped laughing as you knew it was wrong from you to laugh at his uncle.

“We have to choose someone?” – the same elderly man said that was sitting next to Lord Arryn. Sam Tarly cleared his throat as everyone looked at him in silence. – “Why just us?” – you frowned deep as Sam got up from his seat, nervously. – “We represent all the great houses but whoever we choose won’t just rule over lords and ladies…” – You listened closely as Sam was indeed right. – “Maybe the decision about what’s best for everyone should be left to … oh… well everyone?” – Immediately started several ladies and lords to chuckle quietly as they didn’t want to hear another word of this strange request from Sam.

As everyone was looking at each other some lords started to laugh loud at his silly request. – “Maybe we should give the dogs a vote as well!” – Bran’s uncle laughed out as everyone was laughing at Sam. Sam smiled faintly as he tried to hide his sadness and seated himself quickly down. – “Should I ask my horse?” – the old lord laughed out as you had enough of their laughter. – “That’s enough!” – you called out in a calm but powerful tone as they suddenly stopped laughing. – “I suppose you want the crown?” – Bran’s uncle asked Tyrion as Tyrion was looking down in a humble way. – “Me? The imp?” – he shook his head as you felt like there was no progress. – “Half of the people hate me for serving Daenerys, the other half hates me for betraying her…” – Tyrion then briefly looked at Grey Worm who still stood in his soldier position.

“Who then?” – Sir Davos spoke as Tyrion took a deep breath. – “I’ve had nothing else to do but think these past few weeks…” – Tyrion started again, - “about our bloody history!” – He looked brief at his right as he continued, - “About the mistakes we’ve made…” – He looked again brief at Grey worm who rejected his apologetic expression as Tyrion suddenly looked in front of him at you. – “What unites people?” – he spoke again as he started to walk around. – “Armies? Gold? Flags?” – he shook his head as he looked up to his left. – “Stories…”

Tyrion kept walking around as he suddenly paused and slowly turned around. – “And who has a better story than Y/n the valiant!” – All the lord and ladies’ eyes went straight to you as you lifted your hands up from Bran’s shoulder out of shock. Sansa and Arya looked at you with shock as Tyrion kept looking directly at you. – “Lost both of her parents in the war… Survived for many years alone… helped Brandon Stark on his journey beyond the wall…” – Everyone kept looking at you as Tyrion kept telling everyone your life’s story. – “Showed more bravery then anyone I know…” – Tyrion nodded soft at you as you still couldn’t believe that Tyrion wanted you to be Queen of the seven kingdoms.

“Was prepared to sacrifice her own life for the people of Kingslanding that weren’t even her own…” – You were so overwhelmed that you took a step closer to Tyrion, standing next to Bran. – “In the many times I’ve encountered Y/n she kept surprising me with her determination and bravery…” – Tyrion now spoke to the other lords and Ladies as Sansa bit her lip, looking not very pleased with the outcome. – “If there was someone I would believe in, it would be Y/n the valiant!” – You gasped soft as Bran had taken your hand and placed a kiss on it.

“Y/n can’t rule the seven kingdoms?” – Sansa said as you looked at her. – “She’s to young and Bran can’t bare her children!” – You gave her a foul look as Bran looked the same at her. – “Good!” – Tyrion said, - “Children of a Queen can be cruel and stupid… as you know all too well…”  - Sansa stopped talking as Tyrion had shown her, her place. – “I believe in her!” – Bran spoke as he looked up to you and smiled. – “I believe in her too! She will be a great queen that will value the voice of her people!” – Arya said as she nodded at you. You nodded back at her as Bran kissed your hand again.

“Y/n?” – Tyrion asked you as you took some deep breaths. Tyrion then looked at everyone else to see if anyone would protest. – “I believe we should vote then…” – Tyrion looked at his left as you held Bran’s hand firm. – “Aye!” – the first men said out loud as it only increased your nerves. – “Aye!” – the second and the third said. It went so on until you reached Sansa, she turned her body towards you as you prepared yourself to hear a no. – “Y/n if you let me… I want the north to be a free and an independent country… it has suffered more than enough for Westeros!” – You were surprised by her request, but you understood it fully.

“The North is from this day on an independent country!” – You called out as Sansa bowed her head out of respect to you. You did the same as you held one hand near your heart. – “Aye!” – she then said out loud, looking directly at Tyrion. Aria and Bran also said loud ‘Aye!’ as only a few more needed to say their vote. The rest of the lords and ladies all said ‘Aye!’ as Tyrion ended his vote with a nod. Tyrion then signalled to you as you took some more steps, making yourself more visible for everyone. – “All hail Y/n the valiant, First of her name…Queen of the Andals and the first men. Lady of the six kingdoms and protector of the realm!”

It felt glorious to hear the title come out of Tyrion’s mouth as he bowed his head in respect of you. Everyone started to clap loud for you as Tyrion smiled at you. You then moved to the back of Bran’s wheelchair as you started to push him away, all the others followed you as the council was over. Their Queen had been chosen and now they could all return home. You rolled with him in silence past Tyrion as you paused for a moment. – “Grey worm! I will make sure Tyrion will be faced with his actions at my council!” – Grey worm nodded with a forced expression as he removed the chains from around Tyrion’s wrists. – “Thank you, My queen!” – Tyrion said as you nodded at him and continued to walk with Bran to somewhere you could be alone. You leaded him to your tent as Kingslanding needed to be rebuild and it was to dangerous now to head into the city.

You parked Bran’s wheelchair near your bed as you stretched your back a bit, moving over to the mirror stand. Bran pulled himself a bit up by his arms as he wanted to sit down on your bed. You noticed him struggling as you came to his aid. – “You just should have asked!” – you said to him as you grabbed his legs and placed them on the bed. – “And let my Queen do all the work?” – he joked as you slightly shook your head. – “I still can’t believe everyone voted for me to be Queen of the six kingdoms?” – You had placed Bran in the best position for him to sit as you came sitting next to him with a deep exhale. – “You will be wonderful!” – he replied as he suddenly grabbed your waist and let himself fall.

You fell on top of Bran as you squealed loud. – “Brandon!” – you laughed out as he still had his arms around you. You slowly lifted your head to look at him better as he moved some hair of yours behind your ear. – “I don’t think I’m ready for such a big responsibility, Brandon…” – you said to him in a vulnerable tone as you looked away from him. – “Y/n I know for a fact that you will be the best queen, you are kind, strong, wise and most importantly mine…” – Bran forced you to smile as he ticked you soft. – “You truly believe in me?” – Bran nodded deep as you were leaning against his chest, fumbling a piece of his shirt.

Bran then pulled your body more down to reach for your lips as he pressed his lips gently onto yours. You slowly moved your hands to his neck as you kept kissing him repeatedly. Bran then rolled you over to your side so that you were laying next to him. You removed your lips from him and wrapped your arms around him, placing your head on his shoulder. Bran also wrapped his arms around you as he kept cuddling with you. – “I don’t even have a throne?” – you suddenly called out as you pulled your head up. Bran sighed soft as he placed your head down again and let his fingers play with yours. – “We’ll build you a new one… a better one!”

“One without the creepy swords?” – You asked him as Bran hummed deep. – “Without the swords.” – he then kissed the top of your head as you placed your head better on his chest. – “You know me being Queen makes you kind of my King?” – you waited for a moment because you knew Bran never had any intentions of becoming King of anything. – “I would be honoured to be by your side Y/n…” – he replied after a while as you lifted your head up again. – “So… you’re not abandoning me for being Queen?” – Bran gave you a quick shocked expression that you would think like that. – “Y/n I love you more than anything, I would never leave you not even when you are Queen now… I would love to be your King even though I can’t give you any children….” – You moved your hand to his cheek as you looked him into his eyes. – “I don’t want them… just you…” – you then pressed your lips again onto his as you felt him wrap his arms around you better.

summary: Wary, he circled the smooth white trunk until he came to the face. Red eyes looked at him. Fierce eyes they were, yet glad to...
body:
Wary, he circled the smooth white trunk until he came to the face. Red eyes looked at him. Fierce eyes they were, yet glad to see him. The weirwood had his brother’s face. Had his brother always had three eyes?

Not always, came the silent shout. Not before the crow. […] Don’t be afraid, I like it in the dark. No one can see you, but you can see them. But first you have to open your eyes. See? Like this. And the tree reached down and touched him. 

- Jon VII, A Clash of Kings

Here in the chill damp darkness of the tomb his third eye had finally opened. He could reach Summer whenever he wanted, and once he had even touched Ghost and talked to Jon. Though maybe he had only dreamed that.

- Bran VII, A Clash of Kings

trail.content:
Wary, he circled the smooth white trunk until he came to the face. Red eyes looked at him. Fierce eyes they were, yet glad to see him. The weirwood had his brother’s face. Had his brother always had three eyes?

Not always, came the silent shout. Not before the crow. […] Don’t be afraid, I like it in the dark. No one can see you, but you can see them. But first you have to open your eyes. See? Like this. And the tree reached down and touched him. 

- Jon VII, A Clash of Kings

Here in the chill damp darkness of the tomb his third eye had finally opened. He could reach Summer whenever he wanted, and once he had even touched Ghost and talked to Jon. Though maybe he had only dreamed that.

- Bran VII, A Clash of Kings

summary: Sansa:  Have you ever felt like there is this one evil person directing our lives along the most treacherous and unhappy of...
body:
Sansa:  Have you ever felt like there is this one evil person directing our lives along the most treacherous and unhappy of paths?
Tyrion:  No.
Sansa:  Really?
Tyrion:  Not one person.  Two of them.
Jaime:  There's at least three.
Brienne:  I'd go as far as at least four.
Podrick:  Five.
Arya & Gendry:  Six.
Bran:  You're all wrong.
*everyone looks at Bran*:
Bran:  There are exactly seven.
Tyrion:  The Father and the Mother.
Sansa:  The Maiden.
Brienne: The Crone.
Arya:  The Warrior.
Gendry: The Smith.
Jaime: The Stranger.
Bran:  No.  The Seven of whom I speak are evil beyond compare.  They are great and dreadful sorcerers.  Their sole purpose for existence has been to rip us up by the root, chew us up, and spit out what's left and use the power of their minds to see us rendered at the base of bottomless pits for all eternity; alone and unloved.
Sansa:  By the gods!
Tyrion:  You've seen who they are then, Bran?
Bran:  I have.
Jaime *gulps*: Who are they.... these evil sorcerers of whom you speak?
Bran *staring ahead*: Jane of House Espenson. Bryan of House Cogman. Vanessa of House Taylor.  Dave of House Hill. George of House Martin.  David of House Benioff.  And Daniel of House Weiss.
*Sansa shudders, Tyrion reaches for her hand to comfort her*:
Arya:  I know evil.  And those names are certainly filled with it.
Brienne *gripping her sword*:  We will not let them win.
Bran:  No.  And nor will the Tender of Heart, each one of whom will forever set pen to paper and write our lives as they truly could be.
Tyrion:  Could be...?
Bran:  No life is set in stone until it ends; and ours never will as long as the Tender of Heart retain their powers over the evil sorcerers.

summary: Do you have any headcanons about Bran and Arya's childhood? We know they were each other's main playmate, so what games did they...
question: Do you have any headcanons about Bran and Arya's childhood? We know they were each other's main playmate, so what games did they play? Did Bran ever play dolls with Arya (the fact that Arya used to have a doll is adorable, and I love Jon for mentioning it)? What was baby Bran's opinion on vegetables, did he feel menaced by them like Arya did? Did they ever try to sneak out of winterfell? Did they have adventures in the Godswood? Did they share a nursery before Arya moved to Sansa's room?
answer:
My two favorite babies! I’m not clear on all the sorts of games that exist in Westeros or that may be unique to the North but then again we have the opportunity to play in the proverbial sandbox so I guess that doesn’t really matter.

Did Bran ever play dolls with Arya? Possibly, I got my little brother to play dress-up and most children enjoy playing with dolls (legos and toy cars are, by all means, dolls). But by the time of the books he’d just brush it off as too “girly” because toxic masculinity hits hard and early.

I think Bran hates vegetables like Arya did. The moment in ACOK when he sends vegetables to the Frey boys (obligating them to eat the veggies because of courtesy) sticks out in my brain as both a way for him to get rid of a food he didn’t like and to be mean to the Freys.

I don’t think they ever tried sneaking out of WF both because it’s very large and the gates are guarded - I doubt the guards would be dumb enough to let small children go out on their own. The idea of them sneaking past is funny and Bran certainly enjoys sneaking past them when he’s climbing but it’s just not something I see happening.

Did they have adventures in the godswood? Definitely. The Stark kids all have memories of playing in the godswood and the crypts. And considering Bran’s reaction to the vision of Lyanna and Benjen in the godswood it’s pretty clear that Bran and Arya not only played a lot in the godswood but they specifically had mock sword fights.

They probably shared a nursery due to how close they are in age. Actually, it’s likely Sansa was in the nursery with them until she aged out and Rickon was in there before Bran was put in with his brothers - I recall Jon at least thinking about sharing a room with his brothers, brothers plural so Jon, Robb, and Bran apparently shared a room at some point between Bran being aged out of the nursery (I’d estimate age 3-4) and Bran’s fall (when he’s put in his own room, as well as Rickon and Jon leaves for the Wall).

As for what other games Bran and Arya might have played there was probably a mix of rough and tumble play, pranks on their siblings, parents, or innocent bystanders, and established games like the board games Bran plays with the Reeds. Sorry I can’t come up with more details.
